de.tschebbischeff.sunlight

Class LightCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tschebbischeff.sunlight.LightCalculator

  • public class LightCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculates the sunlight that reaches a given point on a planet depending on a light emitter and a light blocking body.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Tarek

    • Field Summary

      • addLightBlocker

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This LightCalculator for fluent method calls.

      • setResolution

        public LightCalculator setResolution(int resolution)
        Sets the resolution of the resulting light calculation. The celestial body will be samples in steps of (1 / 2^resolution) along its azimuth angles and in steps of (2 / 2^resolution) along its zenith angles. The resulting lightmap will be of width 2^resolution and height 2^(resolution-1)+1. The minimum value is 3.
        Parameters:
        resolution - The new resolution to sample the light with.
        Returns:
        This LightCalculator for fluent method calls.

      • calculateAtTime

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage calculateAtTime(double time)
        Calculates the light on the set body at a given time.
        Parameters:
        time - The time at which to calculate positions of the bodies.
        Returns:
        An image of resolution specified in setResolution(int)
